pros: Amazing leadership team and staff. Great small campus atmosphere.

review_title: Great Co-Workers/Horrible Pay/Upper Management Needs to Change
pros: Some of the best and supportive co-works I have ever worked with were at Cleary University.
cons: The pay is well below industry standards and some of the upper management has been there too long and does not know how to manage people.

pros: Not to many students have been forced to go here.
cons: No technology, no business process, low pay instructors, lacrosse as their primary sport!

review_title: A CAN-DO small private not-for-profit university with OUTSTANDING offerings and potential
job_title: Institutional Research Analyst in Howell, MI
pros: The folks at Cleary University from the top down to the bottom up display a "can do" attitude towards solving any and all opportunity challenges they face. Every single person I have encountered works hard for the benefit our our students, staff, faculty, and local community. I have most def seen a group of staff and faculty that want to survive and thrive in the crazy higher education landscape.
cons: There is no "duck and hide" at a small university. You absolutely, positively need to be performing at a top level. There are not the countless layers of administrative bloat that plagues so many other post-secondary education institutions. You need to bring your "A" game every single day. If you are used to hiding while someone else does the work...this isn't the place for you. The ability to wear multiple hats when needed is a bonus.

review_title: It's a pretty good for a workplace
pros:
I have the flexibility in how to present material and when I work
The students are very respectful
The deans check-in and ask about how to support
I have freedom to present material (other colleges did not let me do this)
The school adapts very quickly
The adjunct contracts pay more, the more you teach
cons:
The technology available in classrooms is dated
There is a huge difference depending on what room you are assigned
Although the deans check-in often, the support actually provided is limited. You are more likely to get a pep talk than actually get anything fixed.
While Students are respectful they are less engaged, making teaching more challenging

pros: In general, staff, faculty, and students are great.  Faculty care about student achievement. Flexibility - some positions allow for a ton of flexibility in scheduling.  As another review mentioned, it's a good place to get started teaching, especially if you're available on campus during the days.
cons: Morale - never a good thing when the President says, "any of your jobs are in jeopardy."   Although raises have been pretty regular with the new President, however,  before that, staff endured 7 years with no raises. Financial instability:  constant worry about enrollment and budget.  Annual (at least) staff eliminations using layoffs or organizational reorganization as a reason, and a push to remove staff from the previous admin. Bringing in former colleagues from other failing institutions.  Diminished loyalty to staff and little-to-no professional development.

pros: Great position, lots of opportunities to advance.
cons: Poor organization, sometimes things do not go to plan. People do not have the requirements for their positions sometimes.

pros: Great people, lot of flexibility, high expectations for current leadership direction.
cons: Pay, lack of hours, no advancement opportunities, pretense that having 100% adjuncts is a 'good' thing.

pros: Starting pay was okay but no raises. Experience at Cleary would be perfect for somebody trying to break into higher education.
cons:
Horrible HR and hiring practices
A lot of turnover
A horrible system of record, very dated!
No IT support! It’s all out sourced.
You are expected to use your personal cell phone without any reimbursement.

pros: Flexible job. Supervisor is very good with employee.
cons: I'm so happy when i got a job at Secunda Museum in Cleaty University.

review_title: Faculty are not valued at all!
pros: Students are great and campus is nice (but always empty)!
cons: Low pay and no management leadership!
Management treats employees as LOW priority.  All too frequent lay-offs.
Low hourly pay for student works
